EXPERIENCE   
 
 
 PROCESS CONTR OL SECURITY CONSULTANT, CAPGEMINI / LEIDOS  / LOCKHEED MARTIN , ABERDEEN  
November 2014 – Present  
Conoco Phil lips UK – OT Compliance Proje ct 
ConocoPhillips UK (CoP) had a requirement  to comply with ConocoPhillips Global Engineering 
Standard and UK HSE standards across the Greater Britannia Assets (GBA) and JBlock assets. All assets 
were  to be remediated and compliant by the end of 2018 in preparation for an internal audit April 
2019.   Steps carried out include d: 
• Carried out Review and cross reference the identified documentation.  
• Agre ed and design ed appropriate CoP UK documentation set.  
• Perform ed verification of controls compliance against approved CoP UK documentation set 
and identif ied gaps.  
• Perform ed agreed remediation activity aligned with CoP UK expectation . 
 
Page 2 Nexen  (CNO C) - ICMS Cyber Security Support projec t 
• Reviewed the UK Policy and Procedures and advise on content, structure and gaps for meeting 
the global standard  
o Created new procedures based on gaps identified  
• Review and update System Registers & Network Diagrams  
• Facilitate  HAZAN & Criticality Rankin g based on systems identified during site visits  
Tullow - Jubilee Shutdown  
Consultant  delivering technical architecture review and full documentation set for 
the Jubilee FPSO in Ghana after completion GAP analysis on site.  Tasks include:  
• Change network design and configuration to suit a 3 Tier architecture as defined in ISA/IEC 
62443  
• Define and implement firewall rules to ensure access is limited to authorised personnel and 
systems.  
• Lock down the individual switch ports on all net works to unique MAC addresses to ensure 
that no unauthorised equipment can successfully connect to the network.  
• Remove systems from the network and relocate them in a control network DMZ where they 
can be accessed by the relevant personnel.  
• Creat e new and review and update documentation.  
PCN Security Sustainment Programme   
Technical Lead with a team of 4 dedicated to supporting Chevron North Sea assets.    Tasks  include:    
• Security p olicy , process  and procedure development . 
• Annual, bi-annual and ad-hoc offshore and onshore  visits. 
• Security architecture reviews . 
• Vulnerability, compliance and risk assessment . 
• PCN s ecurity awareness training , development and delivery . 
• Application w hitelisting deployment, management and support . 
• Inventory management  & network surveys . 
• Gap analysis and remediation planning . 
Chevron’s Captain Enhanced Oil Recovery   
Main skills being utilised include:  
• Reviewing  all vendor documentation for accuracy and compliance against the Chevron 
standards  for PCN security . 
• Checking  specification, selection, procurement & installation of security technologies such as 
firewalls, IDS, data d
